questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You need to scan the news for articles about your customers and alert employees when there is a negative article. Positive articles must be added to a press book.
Which natural language processing tasks should you use to complete the process? To answer, drag the appropriate tasks to the correct locations. Each task may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
entity recognition - to get the key phrases talks about by the customers
Sentiment analysis to analyze if the comment is positive or negative
I got this question in my exam - thanks for the support
correct
on test 14/6/22
On exam 3.3.2022
yep agreed

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Entity recognition -
the Named Entity Recognition module in Machine Learning Studio (classic), to identify the names of things, such as people, companies, or locations in a column of text.
Named entity recognition is an important area of research in machine learning and natural language processing (NLP), because it can be used to answer many real-world questions, such as:
✑ Which companies were mentioned in a news article?
✑ Does a tweet contain the name of a person? Does the tweet also provide his current location?
✑ Were specified products mentioned in complaints or reviews?

Box 2: Sentiment Analysis -
The Text Analytics API's Sentiment Analysis feature provides two ways for detecting positive and negative sentiment. If you send a Sentiment Analysis request, the API will return sentiment labels (such as "negative", "neutral" and "positive") and confidence scores at the sentence and document-level.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/studio-module-reference/named-entity-recognition https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/how-tos/text-analytics-how-to-sentiment-analysis

questions.question_text:
You are building a knowledge base by using QnA Maker.
Which file format can you use to populate the knowledge base?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
QnA Maker is now know as Azure Cognitive Service for Language

Selected Answer: D
Accepted formats are...
Structured text: Plain text, RTF, or HTML in a .txt file
Tab-separated values: Structured QnA in a .tsv file
Excel: Structured QnA in an .xlsx file
PDF: FAQs, product manuals, brochures, and more
Markdown: For rich-text editing, including italics, bold, and links

Selected Answer: D
correct answer and explanation

Selected Answer: D
D correct
On exam 3.3.2022
Correct

questions.question_text: In which scenario should you use key phrase extraction?

comments.content:
A. Identifying whether reviews of a restaurant are positive or negative - Key phrase extraction might be helpful in this scenario to extract key phrases or words that indicate sentiment (e.g., "excellent service," "terrible food"). However, other natural language processing techniques like sentiment analysis may be more directly applicable.

So it should be C
Is the option C has incorrect text in it? "identifying which documents provide information about the same topics"

discussion.content: C - "Use key phrase extraction to quickly identify the main concepts in text. For example, in the text "The food was delicious and the staff were wonderful.", key phrase extraction will return the main topics: "food" and "wonderful staff"."

Selected Answer: C
C correct

Answer is C: Key phrase extraction is one of the features offered by Azure AI Language, a collection of machine learning and AI algorithms in the cloud for developing intelligent applications that involve written language. Use key phrase extraction to quickly identify the main concepts in text. For example, in the text "The food was delicious and the staff were wonderful.", key phrase extraction will return the main topics: "food" and "wonderful staff".

Given the example by Microsoft in the key phrase extraction. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/key-phrase-extraction/how-to/call-api we assume the answer is A but as others have pointed out it is C as Sentiment Analysis is needed if it is option A. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview?tabs=prebuilt

Selected Answer: C
The scenario where key phrase extraction is most appropriate is C - Identifying which documents provide information about the same topics.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

comments.content: A says "positive or negative review' which is definitely sentiment analysis and not key phrase extraction

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A
In which scenario should you use a key phrase extraction?
Use key phrase extraction to quickly identify the main concepts in text. For example, in the text "The food was delicious and the staff were wonderful.", key phrase extraction will return the main topics: "food" and "wonderful staff"
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/language-service/key-phrase-extraction/overview

A
In which scenario should you use a key phrase extraction?
Use key phrase extraction to quickly identify the main concepts in text. For example, in the text "The food was delicious and the staff were wonderful.", key phrase extraction will return the main topics: "food" and "wonderful staff"
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/language-service/key-phrase-extraction/overview

comments.content: Wrong. Key phrase extraction will give you the phrases, but wont tell you if the sentiment is positive or negative. You need Sentiment analysis for that.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
correct answer
why not A and C ?

choices.B: generating captions for a video based on the audio track
choices.C: identifying which documents provide information about the same topics
choices.D: translating a set of documents from English to German
choices.A: identifying whether reviews of a restaurant are positive or negative

questions.question_text:
You have insurance claim reports that are stored as text.
You need to extract key terms from the reports to generate summaries.
Which type of AI workload should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Key phrase extraction is probably best, but NLP gets the job done.

Selected Answer: A
correct
The AI workload that could be used to extract key terms from text reports to generate summaries is Natural Language Processing (NLP).
Ans is correct... NLP can extract key terms from the reports to generate summaries.

questions.answer_description:
Natural language processing (NLP) is used for tasks such as sentiment analysis, topic detection, language detection, key phrase extraction, and document categorization.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/architecture/data-guide/technology-choices/natural-language-processing
